questions.answer_description:
Part of the "show ip ospf topology" command on R5 shows this:

The Link ID of R3 (3.3.3.3) shows the age is 1858.

discussion.content:
Correct output on the R5 should be received by using the "show" command:
R5#show ip ospf database
Keyword "topology" prelates to EIGRP.

Router#show ip route
... [AD, "metric"]
...
Router#show ip eigrp topology
... (feasible-distance, advertised-distance)

Should be noted that advertised-distance from "show ip eigrp topology" output and "metric" value in "show ip route" output are the very same.

comments.content: issue show ip eigrp <AS> topology command if router don't accept show ip eigrp topology

questions.answer_description:
show ip eigrp topology
The numbers after the route specify the administrative distance of the route (90 for EIGRP) and the distance metric of that particular route, which is shows as
1810944 for the 192.168.46.0 route.
